event.summary: 10/29/1993: Police said they recovered 2,300 electronic detonators and 165 pounds (75 kg) of gelatin a day after a powerful homemade bomb wrapped in a shopping bag exploded on a crowded Mumbai train. The explosion killed two passengers and wounded 44. Pakistani Militants were suspected.
event.target1: The second-class car of a Mumbai commuter train.
event.weapdetail: A powerful homemade bomb wrapped in a shopping bag.
event.addnotes: It was suspected that Pakistan's military-run Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) were involved in this attack. There was no further information on this, however.
event.scite1: "Two Wounded in Bombay Train Blast Die in Hospital,” United International Press, October 30, 1993.
event.scite2: "Bombay Police Reports Busting New Bombing Plot,” United Press International, October 31, 1993.
